name: VINTAGE FELCA WORLDTIMER SUPERCOMPRESSOR
description:
Here's a massive vintage 1960s Felca Seascoper Worldtime supercompressor that is just...so...cool.  

Check out the minty gray dial with arrow-tipped seconds hand and the star of the show: that amazing orange, white and blue rotating world-time chapter ring.

This is a heavy, massive 42mm wide, excluding the two cross-hatched crowns (the upper controls the world time bezel, the lower the time.) ...by 50mm from lug to lug. 

The 17-jewel automatic movement has been serviced and is keeping excellent time. 

These supercompressors are hot and when you strap this one on you will know why.

name: ZODIAC SUPER SEA WOLF - THE KING!
description:
Zodiac fans, gather round: You know this magnificent beast. 

The 1970s Zodiac Super Sea Wolf automatic. 

Super in every way...Super sized: a massive 44mm wide, excluding the unsigned screw-down crown...by 51mm from lug to lug. 

This watch is in excellent condition throughout. A few scratches, a bit of wear on the crystal, but nothing major and certainly nothing to detract from the immense appeal of this classic. 

The 17-jewel automatic movement is keeping excellent time. The hacking mechanism works. This is not a quick-set date model. Photo of mechanism available on request.
 

This is one of the great iconic watches of the 1960s and 70s.  Can you live without it? You cannot.

name: VINTAGE ZODIAC SEA-CHRON VALJOUX 72 MANUAL
description:
Zodiac fans -- and we count ourselves among them -- need no introduction to this legend: a 1960s Zodiac Sea-Chron with the famous Valjoux 72 movement. 

Magnificent. 

Minty charcoal-black dial with silvered hands and a matching silver bezel. 

Who ever did it better? 

This beast is 37mm across, excluding the signed Zodiac crown.

The bezel turns freely both ways, and has one blemish, near the 30. Otherwise it is excellent. 

The crystal is clear. 

The manual winding Valjoux 72 has recently been serviced and is keeping excellent time. The pushers work as they should. 

These Sea-Chrons are rare and highly sought after.  Strap it on and you will know why. And get ready for some jealous stares.

name: VINTAGE LORD ELGIN 14K SOLID GOLD MANUAL FLARED BATWING LUGS
description:
In the 1950s, Lord Elgin pioneered some of the most innovative American watch designs ever. Case in point: this 1950s classic in solid 14k gold. 

The star of this show: Those massive, flared batwing lugs. 

Cool. 

Check out the minty jet black dial...the geometric subdial, the slashing hands. 
Who ever did Deco better? 

Classic dimensions: 21mm wide, excluding the unsigned crown, by a massive 38mm from lug to lug. 

The 21-jewel Elgin manual movement keeps excellent time. 

A Deco classic in excellent condition. Solid 14k. What else could you want?

name: VINTAGE OMEGA SPEEDMASTER TV SCREEN CHRONO AUTO
description:
Omega made many specatcular Speedmaster variations in the 1970s but none cooler than this.  A mid-1970s Speedmaster TV screen, named, of course, for the shape of the case. 

Check out the charcoal dial bristling with subdials... the airplane hand is a minute counter, by the way. 

This is a massive , heavy beast, 38mm wide, excluding the signed crown, by 42mm from lug to lug. 

Crystal is clear. 

The original Omega heavy-link stainless steel bracelet fits a 7.25 inch wrist comfortably and it is magnificent. 


The Caliber 1045 automatic movement is keeping excellent time, and all chrono functions work as they should. So does quickset day and date function. 

You don't see these watches in this excellent condition very often. 

This Mark V ruled the world before the Planet Oceans and other behemoths arrived. Guess what? It still rules.

name: VINTAGE HAMILTON VAN HORN ELECTRIC - A LEGEND!
description:
Here's one of the first in an amazingly innovative line of Hamilton Electrics...a circa 1958 Van Horn in solid 14k gold. 

Check out the minty, satin and gold dial...those cool arrowhead markers..the slashing gold hands...and those amazing flared ribbon lugs. 

This is a classic for all times: 34mm excluding the signed Hamilton crown..by 42mm from lug to lug. 

The 14k solid gold case is in excellent condition, with minor scratches. 

The most important piece of information: the Hamilton 500 movement is keeping excellent time. 

This was named for one of the pioneers of the electric watch at Hamilton.  Throughout the 1950s and early 1960s, Hamilton produced some of the most astonishing watches ever. Here's one.

name: MEGA-RARE VINTAGE LONGINES 14K SOLID WHITE GOLD MANUAL w/SCROLL LUGS - AWESOME!
description:
Here's a vintage Longines that you don't see every day: 

A 1950s solid 14k white gold Longines manual with those huge scrolled lugs. Some call them mustache-lugs. Whatever you call them, they are cool. 

AND a diamond dial. 11 in all, count 'em. 

Classic dimensions for this legend: 30mm wide, excluding the unsigned crown...by 38mm from lug to amazing lug. 

The two-tone dial has a bit of light patina, nothing major, nothing that detracts from the immense power of this classic. 

The Longines 22L 17-jewel movement winds and sets like silk. Keeps excellent time. 

Want a vintage that will turn heads. Start here.

name: VINTAGE ROLEX GMT II w/BOX AND PAPERS
description:
Here's a vintage 2007 Rolex Oyster Perpetual GMT II automatic with ceramic bezel with all of its boxes and papers. 

Jet black dial. Mint. Green GMT hand. Scratch free bezel and crystal. 

What else can you say but: Magnificent. 

This is a megaclassic, 40mm across, excluding the signed, screwdown crown by 46mm from lug to massive lug. 

The 3186 movement keeps excellent time, as you'd expect.

Full oyster bracelet, which fits a 7.5 inch wrist comfortably. Excellent condition throughout. No issues whatsoever for this M series, Model 116710. 

Goes with everything from tuxedo to jeans. 

I will ship internationally, but international buyers must pay by bank wire. No Pay Pal on this one, sorry. For more photos, please inquire. 

Want to turn heads? Strap this on. You will.

name: VINTAGE BREITLING TRANSOCEAN CHRONO
description:
A 1970s megaclassic. The solid stainless steel Breitling Transocean Chrono with original band. 

Red subdial hands, blue background, silvery dial...and a red seconds hand. 

What else could you ask for? 

The case and dial are excellent, with a bit of paint loss on subdial hands

This Breitling 7102 is a massive 42mm wide, by 42mm from lug to lug. .

The manual Valjoux 7740 movement is keeping excellent time. 

The band fits a 7.4 inch wrist comfortably.  A few scratches on the caseback, but that's about it. 

These Breitling chronos from the 1970s are in hot demand. Find out why!

name: WYLER DYNAWIND DIVER 660 SUPERCOMPRESSOR
description:
Yes, we love these massive supercompressor divers, and none more than this 1960s Wyler Dynawind 660.

Two-tone blue and gray bull's eye dial. Huge arrow minute hand. Red-tipped seconds hand. 

Cool. 

This massive stainless steel case is 39mm wide, excluding the two signed crowns (the lower for the time, the upper to rotate the inner bezel.) 

The automatic movement keeps excellent time. Photos on request. 

Here's a diver that sets you apart. Strap it on. People will notice.

name: VINTAGE WITTNAUER SUPERCOMPRESSOR
description:
Here's a mid-1960s Wittnauer Supercompressor... all stainless steel... dual crown ... and top of the line. 

Jet black dial. White numerals. Chunky hands and markers. 

This is a hefty 36mm across, excluding the signed and cross-hatched Wittnauer crowns, by 42.5 mm from lug to beefy lug. The solid stainless steel case has a few deeper scratches on the back, but nothing major and nothing that detracts from the immense appeal of this watch. 

The 17-jewel automatic movement keeps excellent time. 

These supercompressors are in white-hot demand and you can see why..

name: VINTAGE OMEGA FLIGHTMASTER CHRONO
description:
Mega-cool Omega Flightmaster from early 1970s.  

Before there were Planet Oceans and massive Deep Sea Dwellers, there was this 1970s icon: the Omega Flightmaster. 

Behold this behemoth: a slab of steel, 43mm wide, excluding the signed Omega crown...by a massive 53mm - yes, 53 -- from lug to lug. Some light scratches on the back of the case, nothing major. 

Check out the minty black dial, bristling with subdials with yellow subhands ... and that cool blue-tipped Gmt hand...all adjusted by one of FIVE crowns. 

The color coded pushers are all intact, a rarity in these watches. 

The crystal is new and flawless. 

The original stainless steel Omega bracelet is excellent, and fits up to a 7.5 inch wrist.  

The highly sought Caliber 910 manual winding movement is keeping great time. 

In the age of the monster watch, here's one that still turns heads. Guaranteed.

name: VINTAGE WITTNAUER AUTO STEEL AMAZING
description:
Looking for a cool vintage watch that not everyone else has? 

Check out this 1960s Wittnauer with a textured dial and blued seconds hand....AND the highlight: those cool, geometric number markers. Never seen anything like that before or since. 

The dial has some light patina, nothing major, nothing to detract from the immense appeal of this watch. 

Classic dimensions on this stainless case with gold-filled bezel: 33mm wide, excluding the unsigned crown...by 37mm from lug to lug.. 

The 17-jewel Wittnauer automatic movement keeps excellent time.

name: VINTAGE HAMILTON AUTO -- RED, WHITE and BLUE
description:
Here's a 1960s Hamilton in red, white, and blue. 

Red seconds hand, blue chapter ring against a silver dial. Flat-out cool. 

The solid-stainless steel case is a hefty 36mm wide, excluding the signed non-Hamilton crown...by 40mm from lug to lug.  

The 17-jewel Hamilton movement keeps excellent time. 

Comes on an aftermarket stainless steel band with a Hamilton signed clasp, which fits a 7.5 inch wrist comfortably. 

Here's a watch to salute!

name: VINTAGE ROLEX OYSTER PERPETUAL DATEJUST TWO-TONE AUTO
description:
Here's a megaclassic from Rolex: a 1970s Oyster Perpetual Datejust Two-Tone on a massively cool 18k-and-stainless jubilee bracelet. 

Check out that cool champagne-gold dial with the gold stick hands. 

Classic dimensions: 36mm wide, excluding the signed, screw-down Rolex crown..by 42mm from lug to lug. The case is in excellent condition. 

This is the model 1601, powered by a caliber 1570 automatic movement. 

The 18k-and-stainless steel jubilee band easily fits a 7.25 inch but comes with 2 links to expand to 7.5.

Slip it on. Make heads turn.

name: VINTAGE MEGA-RARE 1970s IWC AUTO w/DATE
description:
You don't see this every day: a 1970s IWC Caliber 854b in excellent condition WITH the original stainless steel IWC-signed bracelet. 

Check out the slate gray dial with a few blemishes, as befits a watch of this vintage...
And the huge oval-shaped stainless steel case is 45mm wide excluding the signed IWC crown....by 41mm from lug to lug. 

The case has an amazing starburst finish, and there are a few noticeable scratches and tiny dings that are difficult to capture in photos. Nothing to detract from the immense appeal of this classic, however. 

The IWC-signed bracelet fits a 7 3/8-inch wrist and is in excellent condition. 

The Caliber 8541b automatic movement with hacking feature is working perfectly. 

Want a vintage that everyone else DOESN'T have? Here it is.

name: VINTAGE UNIVERSAL GENEVE POLEROUTER SUB
description:
You don't see this one everyday: a classic 1980s Universal Geneve Polerouter sub. 

Check out the minty black dial with red accents, and that cool red trident in the Sub nameplate...and the red seconds hand. 

This one was languishing in a drawer -- imagine! -- for decades, before my master watchmaker brought it back to life. 

Classic dimensions in the all stainless steel case: 40mm wide, excluding the signed crown...by 48mm from lug to lug. A few scratches, nothing major. 

The diver's bezel rotates easily in either direction. 

The original cyclops crystal has a few tiny scratches, nothing distracting.

The 28-jewel automatic movement is freshly overhauled and keeps excellent time.

Comes on an aftermarket stainless bracelet. 

These Polerouter Subs are hot and getting hotter. One reason: they're scarce.

name: VINTAGE BUCHERER 18K SOLID GOLD MANUAL
description:
Here's a vintage Bucherer with a cool slate-gray textured dial in 18k solid yellow gold. 

Check out the mint dial in the minimalist Calatrava style...the gold markers and slashing gold hands. Who ever did it better? 

Classic dimensions: 34mm wide, excluding the signed Bucherer crown...by 36mm from lug to elegant lug. 

The 17-jewel manual movement keeps excellent time. 

Want to turn heads? Strap this on.

name: VINTAGE LECOULTRE MEMOVOX HPG - 14K SOLID GOLD w/10K GF LECOULTRE BRACELET -- ANOTHER GRAIL!!!!
description:
Here's a "grail" watch for Lecoultre fans -- and who isn't? 

A 1970s Lecoultre Memovox HPG in solid, heavy 14k gold....and here's the amazing part, WITH the original matching 10k gold-filled Lecoultre bracelet. 

The case is massive, solid 14k, in the classic dimensions: 37mm wide by 42mm from lug to lug. 

The gold two-tone dial is in mint condition with cool gold markers and the date at the 6. The only imperfection is some paint loss at the very edge of the crystal from the 8 to the 11 and from the 1 to the 3. Very difficult to photograph this and you'd have to be paying close attention to even see it. 

As we said, these 14k Memovoxes in the classic oval style don't come around often, particularly with the matching band. About the band: It will fit a 7.5 inch wrist snugly. There is a minor amount of wear-through at the edge of a couple of links on the bottom side and a bit along one edge of the clasp...very, very minor. 

The watch is, in a word, magnificent. The caliber 916 movement keeps excellent time. The alarm works well. 

Want to turn heads. Starting with yours?

name: VINTAGE HAMILTON PAN-EUROP BLUE DIAL AUTO STEEL MAGNIFICENT
description:
A classic that all Hamilton fans recognize (and one of our personal favorites!): The recent reimagining of the Hamilton Pan Europ, the original with the cool midnight blue dial. 

The 1971 model is a classic. And so is this reissue, emblazoned on the back with the year, 1971, that the Pan Europ chrono was born. 

Midnight blue dial that changes with the light. Red chronograph hands. Date at the 6, (with quick change controlled by a button on the left side at the 11.) And that cool diver's bezel, each turn marked by a satisfying click. 

The massive stainless steel case is excellent...45mm across, excluding the signed crown...by 49 from lug to lug .

The automatic movement keeps excellent time. 

Comes on a leather Hamilton band with deployment clasp in excellent condition. 

This comes with box, papers and original hang tag.

name: VINTAGE HAMILTON DIAMOND DIAL 14K SOLID ROSE GOLD MANUAL - MAGNIFICENT!
description:
Here's a Deco classic from Hamilton. And I do mean classic.

Coppery diamond dial with just a touch of patina. A 14K solid rose gold case in excellent condition, with matching rose gold-topped Foster expandable band. And don't forget ... those magnificent hooded lugs. 

Classic dimensions of the era:  21mm wide, excluding the unsigned crown by a massive 40mm from lug to hooded lug. 

The domed crystal is new. 

The 17-jewel manual winding movement is freshly overhauled and keeping excellent time. 

These Hamilton diamond dial watches represent the pinnacle of style in the Deco era. Slip it on and you'll see why.

name: VINTAGE ENICAR DIVER AUTO STEEL
description:
You don't see this Enicar every day: A cool jet black 1960s Diver.

Chunky steel hands, red-tipped arrow seconds hand, jet black dial...enough said! 

This is a wearable 35mm wide, excluding the signed Enicar crown...by 44mm from lug to massively sculpted lug. 

The solid stainless steel case is in very good condition, with some minor scratching throughout. Nothing major, nothing to distract from this rare find.  

The bezel, which fits perfectly but is not original to the watch, turns unidirectionally. 

The 17-jewel automatic movement keeps excellent time. 

Strap it on and make heads swivel!

name: VINTAGE WAKMANN ALARM MANUAL
description:
Who doesn't love these Wakmann alarm watches? 

Check out the cool near mint silvered dial with chunky markers...and that red-arrow alarm indicator...set it and the alarm rings loud and clear! 

The chunky stainless steel case is in excellent condition. It is 35mm wide, excluding the unsigned crowns by a beefy 41mm from lug to sculpted lug. 

The 17-jewel manual mechanism, labeled Alstater, winds and sets smoothly and keeps excellent time. 

Alarm watches are in hot demand. Find out why.

name: VINTAGE BULOVA ACCUTRON 219
description:
Here's one of the most amazing Bulova Accutrons every produced. 

The star of this show: That killer brushed gold, textured dial, surrounded by the gold-filled coin-edge bezel. 

Classic dimensions for this 1969 Accutron: 37mm wide, excluding the signed crown by 40mm from lug to lug. 

The 219 movement is freshly serviced, keeping excellent time with a fresh battery. 

Comes on the original Accutron-signed  stainless and gold tone link band, which fits a 7.5 inch wrist comfortably. 

Want an Accutron that not everyone else has? Here it is.

name: VINTAGE ZODIAC TRIPLE CALENDAR MOON PHASE
description:
Here's a 1960s mega-classic from Zodiac.  Jet black. Red arrow date indicator. Gold hands. Moon phase. On a stainless steel and gold-filled JB Champion band. 

So cool. 

The gold-filled case is 35mm wide by 42mm from lug to lug. 

All pushers and functions work well. 

The JB Champion band fits a 7.5 inch wrist.

name: VINTAGE NIVADA CHRONO ORANGE!
description:
Here's a classic 1970s Nivada chrono, in dark gray with cool orange seconds hand and subdial accent. 

Who can have enough orange watches? 

The brushed-finish stainless steel case is a massive 38mm wide, excluding the unsigned crown, by 42 mm from lug to lug. It is in excellent shape, with some typical scratches throughout. 

The 17-jewel Landeron 187 chrono movement is keeping excellent time. 

All chrono functions work as they should. 

Want a vintage chrono that not everyone else has?

name: VINTAGE OMEGA CONSTELLATION w/OMEGA BEADS OF RICE BRACELET
description:
Omega fans, gather round. 

Here's one of our all-time favories: a circa 1962 Omega Constellation in solid stainless steel, with a magnificent Omega beads of rice bracelet. 

Check out the expertly refinished pearl satin dial with the slashing steel hands.   

And our favorite part: the solid gold Observatory ingot on the back, with all eight stars shining brightly! 

Classic dimensions in the solid stainless case with the 14k gold bezel:  34mm wide, excluding the signed crown...by 42mm from lug to beefy lug. 

The Omega-signed beads of rice bracelet is in excellent condition, and will fit a 7.5 inch wrist. 

The Caliber 501 movement is keeping excellent time, as you'd expect. 

The Constellation is the top of Omega's line, a classic in every way. 

Strap it on. You will be mesmerized.

name: VINTAGE WALTHAM BLUE SPACE AGE COOL MANUAL
description:
Here's a barely worn, if at all, Waltham Incabloc with a cool blue oval Space Age dial and the hang tag still on! And the back price sticker. And the box and papers! 

This is a workhorse watch from the 1970s, with a stainless steel back and chromed case. It's 35mm wide, excluding the signed crown by 42mm from lug to lug .

Comes on a cool Waltham-signed oyster-style band. 

The 17-jewel Incabloc manual movement is keeping excellent time. 

With the cobalt blue box and papers.

name: VINTAGE BULOVA "STARS AND STRIPES" CHRONO - THE BEAST LIVES!
description:
Gotta love this massive 1970 Bulova "Stars and Stripes" chronograph. 

This beast is a 43mm wide, excluding the signed crown...a modern-sizded monster watch before they were in style! 

Check out the cool red-tipped arrow hands, the concentric circles of blue and red and white...all set in that cool, serrated edge stainless steel case. 

We'd salute this one! 

The manual wind chrono movement is keeping excellent time. Photos of movement available on request. 

Comes on a stainless steel mesh band that will fit a 7.5 inch wrist.

name: VINTAGE GLYCINE SST "PUMPKIN"
description:
Glycine rivals Zodiac for intense fans and some of the most arresting designs ever. 

Here's a classic Glycine Airman SST, known as the "Pumpkin" for obvious reasons! 

Check out the minty 25-hour pilot's dial...in cool orange and gray. 

This is a massive watch, 42mm wide, excluding the two original crosshatched crowns...by 48mm from lug to beefy lug.  The stainless case is in very good condition, with some scratching throughout...Nothing major, and certainly nothing to detract from immense appeal of this watch.

The 17-jewel automatic movement keeps excellent time.  Date changes as it should. The inner bezel also rotates properly. 

You want a vintage Glycine that not everyone else has?

name: VINTAGE LECOULTRE MEMOVOX AUTO ROMAN NUMERAL JUMBO
description:
LeCoultre fans, gather round: Here's a peerless 1970s Memovox with an ultra-cool roman numeral dial. The killer combination: Black and gold against a satin-white backdrop with just a touch of patina to let you know that this is an honest vintage masterpiece. 

The stainless steel-backed case is is an oversized 38mm wide, excluding the unsigned crowns, by 45mm from lug to lug.  The bezel is 10k gold filled and has a few light scratches, nothing to distract from the immense appeal of this classic. 

The Lecoultre K815 17-jewel automatic movement keeps excellent time. The alarm rings loud and clear. 

These Memovoxes have an intense following among Lecoultre fans. FInd out why.

name: VINTAGE OMEGA SPEEDMASTER MOON WATCH w/ORIGINAL BRACELET
description:
The legendary Omega Speedmaster triple chronograph, first watch worn on the moon. 

This one is a circa 1979 vintage, a decade after Neil Armstong & Co. landed on the moon. It is in excellent condition, the 861 caliber manual movement freshly serviced and keeping time just as it should.

Check out the jet-black, minty dial.  

Classic dimensions: 40mm wide, excluding the signed crown, by 48mm from lug to massive lug. 

Black tachymeter bezel has a few small dings, including one at the 300 mark and a tiny mark on the T of Tachymeter. Nothing major. Crystal is excellent. 

Comes on the original Omega stainless steel bracelet, with quite a bit of stretch but still extremely wearable. Fits a 7.5 inch wrist. If you need extra links, please ask. 

This Speedmaster has endured for generations because it goes with anything from jeans to tuxedo. It is never out of place. It truly is a moon shot of a watch!

name: VINTAGE OMEGA SEAMASTER SOLID 18K ROSE GOLD BUMPER AUTO
description:
Here's a circa 1950 Omega Seamaster in solid 18k rose gold. Magnificent!


Check out the satin dial with some well-earned patina, including a blemish between the 4 and 5 marker. But nothing that detracts from the immense appeal of this classic. 

The slashing gold hands and red-arrow tipped seconds hand. 

And those cool scrolled lugs. 

The solid 18k rose gold case is 35mm wide, excluding the signed Omega crown, by 40mm from lug to lug. It is in excellent condition with just some light scratches. 

The Caliber 351 bumper movement thumps satisfyingly with every shake. 
Keeps excellent time, too!

name: UNIVERSAL GENEVE UNISONIC w/BOX and PAPERS
description:
Here's a 1960s Universal Geneve Unisonic with a buzzsaw blue dial, one of the most amazing dials I've ever seen. 

Once you pull your eyes from the dial, you'll see a crisp 35mm wide cushion case, excluding the signed Universal crown...by 38mm from lug to lug. 

So cool. 

Keeping excellent time with a fresh battery. The Spiedel metal band fits a smaller wrist, about 7 inches or so. 

Comes with full box and papers, as pictured. 

You don't see this watch often and you won't see it here for long!

name: VINTAGE UNIVERSAL GENEVE MANUAL PINSTRIPED PIEPAN DIAL
description:
Here's a 1960s Universal Geneve with a pinstriped piepan dial that is just so ... cool. 

Classic black and tan on this, with a bit of very light  spotting in a few places, as photos show. Nothing major, nothing to detract from the immense appeal of this vintage masterpiece. 

The solid stainless case is 35mm wide, excluding the unsigned crown by 42 from lug to beefy lug. 

The 17-jewel Caliber 332 manual winding movement is keeping excellent time. One small issue: the crown pulls out and sets fine, but it doesn't stay out unless you hold it. A minor issue that doesn't affect the working of the watch. 

Want a vintage classic not everyone else has?

name: VINTAGE BULOVA ACCUTRON ASTRONAUT w/14K Bezel and 10K KREISLER COFFINLINK BRACELET -- GRAIL TIME!
description:
Accutron fans -- and who isn't -- know this one cold: A 1966 Astronaut with solid 14k bezel...and a 10k gold-filled Kreisler coffin link band. This is what's known in the watch biz as a "grail" watch -- the one you seek for years...

Here it is. 

The 14k gold-filled case is excellent, 38mm wide..a few scratches, nothing major. 

The Kreisler coffin-link band fits a 7.5 inch wrist comfortably. 

Comes with an Accutron box. 

Ever want one of those watches that makes heads turn? Here it is.

name: VINTAGE LECOULTRE SOLID 14K WHITE GOLD WATCH
description:
One of the most unusual LeCoultres ever produced....A circa 1955 classic in solid 14k white gold. 

Amazing. 

Check out the jet black dial surrounded by raised white gold rivets. 

This is a smaller size as befits the period, 31mm wide by 35mm from lug to lug. 

The 17-jewel Caliber 480 manual movement is keeping excellent time. 

Want a vintage that not everyone else has? 

Here it is.

name: VINTAGE LECOULTRE FUTUREMATIC
description:
Gather round, LeCoultre fanatics. (We're including ourselves in that description.) 

You know what we have here. A vintage LeCoultre Futurematic, in near NOS shape. Minty dial with just a touch of patina around the 11 to 1 markers. And 10k gold filled case. With those massive lugs! 

The 17-jewel bumper automatic 497 movement is freshly overhauled...working perfectly, as is the power reserve. Just. SO. Cool.  

You don't see these in this kind of excellent condition often. 

That's why we are proud to sell this watch!

name: VINTAGE ACCUTRON ASTRONAUT w/BULLET BAND and BOXES - FULL SET!
description:
No Accutron fan needs an introduction to this legend: A 1967 Astronaut with the original bullet band and both inner and outer boxes. The price tag is still on the outer box: $175. 

Check out the minty jet-black dial.. 38mm....the slashing hands, the terrific gmt pointer.  Any wonder this is a legend? 

Serviced last year and running great. 

The original steel bullet band fits a 7.5 inch wrist comfortably. 

The original box is in excellent condition. 

IF you ever wanted one of these, now is the time.

name: VINTAGE ENICAR SHERPA GUIDE STEEL AUTO MAGNIFICENT
description:
An icon of vintage watches: The 1970s Enicar Sherpa Guide in excellent condition. 

Gotta love that jet-black dial with the tan-and-black inner chapter ring, controlled by one of two signed crowns. And that red and black checkered GMT hand...and the red seconds hand...and the red inner pointer ....and the cool world time bezel...

and...and...and...

Well, OK, this is one of those vintage watches that collectors around the world crave. You can see why

A wearable 42mm excluding the crowns...by 52mm from lug to massive lug. 

There is some wear to the outer edge of the bezel, as is common, but nothing that detracts from the immense appeal of this watch. 

Bezel turns freely in both directions. 

Automatic movement keeping excellent time. 

What more could you ask? 

Email me if you just want to chat about this watch..or hit the buy button!

name: VINTAGE LADIES GIRARD PERREGAUX 18k with solid 18k gold mesh band
description:
Here's an wonderfully old-school ladies' Girard Perregaux solid 18k gold watch with a SOLID 18k mesh band. So cool! 

It's a manual, and small by today's monster standards: 15mm square, excluding the signed crown. 

End to end, the watch measures a little over 6 inches. 

Or, for goldbugs, 28 pennyweights. 

Don't make them like this anymore!

name: VINTAGE AQUADIVE DIVER AUTO STEEL AWESOME
description:
Here's a vintage 1970s Aquadive diver, 666 feet, a classic in so many ways. 

Check out the multi-color diver's bezel, for one.  The red-black-gray dial. Those strong hands and the lumed seconds hand. 

This is a model 1939, one of those 1970s beasts, a solid 38mm wide, excluding the unsigned crown, by a massive 46mm from lug to lug. 

The 25-jewel Swiss movement is freshly serviced, keeping excellent time.

This also has a quick-date change function, working well. 

All in all, these Aquadive watches are rare and so hot. Want to know why? Strap it on. You won't want to take it off.

name: VINTAGE LECOULTRE MEMOVOX w/ORIGINAL BRACELET
description:
Who can resist this Lecoultre? Not us. 

A 1970s stainless steel classic with the original stainless steel band. 

Check out that excellent two-tone dial with Deco numerals...So cool. 

The solid stainless steel case is 34mm wide excluding the two signed Lecoultre crowns....by a massive 42 mm from lug to lug. 

You don't see the original band on these often, but here it is. Note, the clasp is unsigned, but the inner bracelet carries the JLC logo. 

All functions working perfectly...

All desires for the watch perfectly normal...

name: VINTAGE ETERNA KONTIKI with ORIGINAL BRACELET
description:
Here's a classic you don't see too often, a vintage 1970s Eterna Kontiki with the original stainless steel link bracelet. 

Check out the brawny silver dial, with those huge markers.  

Classic dimensions: 36mm wide excluding the unsigned, screw-down crown... by 44mm from lug to beefy lug. 

And, of course the famous Kontiki medallion on the back, shining on. 

The stainless steel bracelet fits a 7.4 inch wrist comfortably...

The watch is keeping excellent time...photos of movement available on request. 

Strap it on. Heads will swivel. Guaranteed!

name: VINTAGE RITMO MUNDO GRAN DATA PURPLE PURPLE PURPLE
description:
Here's a 2007 Ritmo Mundo Gran Data in NU Wildcat purple! 

Gotta love it. Exploding numeral dial. Italian design worn by celebrities like Jeremy Piven on "Entourage."  

HUGE...55mm long, polished stainless steel case by 39 wide. 

No one can miss this watch. It shouts. 

Quartz movement, keeping excellent time. On a Ritmo leather strap with Ritmo clasp.  Comes with case and warranty card.

name: VINTAGE WOMENS ROLEX OYSTER PERPETUAL DATEJUST ROMAN DIAL MIDSIZE - SOLD!
description:
Here's a two-tone women's Rolex Oyster Perpetual Datejust with a magnificent 18k gold and stainless jubilee bracelet.  

Check out the gray roman numeral dial surrounded by the 18k serrated bezel...so cool. 
 
This is a midsized model, 68273, with an "R" serial number that dates it to the late 1980s. It's 30mm wide excluding the signed, screw-down crown, by 37mm from lug to lug. 

The Caliber 2135 automatic movement keeps excellent time. 

The steel-and-18k gold jubilee bracelet will fit a 7-inch wrist comfortably. 

Perfection.

name: VINTAGE GLYCINE AIRMAN - SOLD!
description:
Glycine fans need no introduction this classic: a 1960s Airman. 

Check out the jetblack dial...the red date window, the amazing arrow-tipped hour hand. 

So. Cool. 

This is an iconic 24-hour pilot's watch, popular among airmen in the Vietnam war.  

A hefty 37mm, excluding crowns, by 44mm from lug to lug. 

This one has a new authentic Glycine Airman crystal. 

The 23-jewel automatic movement, freshly overhauled, keeps excellent time. 

Always wanted to own a piece of history? Here's your chance.

name: VINTAGE LECOUTRE MEMOVOX HPG ORANGE AND BLUE AND COOL - SOLD!
description:
Anyone who comes to VWC knows we have a passion for LeCoultre. Why? Check out this 1970s Memovox HPG: 

The killer blue-and-orange concentric ring dial, the cool silver block markers, orange date window. How could anyone resist? 

Classic dimensions: 37mm wide, excluding the unsigned crowns..by 42mm from lug to lug. 

The 17-jewel automatic movement keeps excellent time. The alarm function works, loud and clear! 

Comes on an NSA stainless steel bracelet that snugly fits a 7.5 inch  wrist. 

These Memovoxes are in blistering demand ... and you can see why.

name: VINTAGE ROLEX PRESIDENT 18K SOLID GOLD w/18K BARK BAND- SOLD
description:
Here's a vintage circa 1979 Rolex President Oyster Perpetual Day Date with diamond dial and bezel in solid 18k gold ... with a full length, solid 18k gold bark-finish band.

Only one word for this: Magnificent. Check out the luminous dark blue dial, diamonds marking the hours...and that cool diamond bezel. 

This is a heavy gold watch, with classic dimensions: 36mm wide, excluding the signed Rolex screw-down crown...by 42mm from lug to massive lug.  

Rolexes don't come any luxurious than this. 

The heavy 18k gold Rolex band with the sought-after bark finish is excellent, and will fit a 7.5 inch wrist comfortably. 

This is model number 18038, and the serial number is in the 5 million range. 

The Caliber 3055 automatic movement keeps excellent time, as you'd expect. The quick-set date change works flawlessly. 

Comes in a small green Rolex box, but no papers. Strap this on and you won't want to take it off.

name: VINTAGE CYMA AUTO STEEL GUILLOCHE DIAL MAGNIFICENT
description:
Here's a newer Cyma automatic with an amazing mint guilloche dial, a cool porthole-style subdial and a museum back to showcase the 27-jewel movement. 

Just. So. Cool. 

This a heavy but wearable 38mm across, excluding the crown, by 44mm from lug to massive lug. 

Check out the 27-jewel automatic movement in the museum-display case back. Flawless. 

The heavy solid stainless steel chain link band fits a 7.5 inch wrist and one extra link is included. 

Comes with box but no papers.

name: VINTAGE BULOVA SNORKEL ORANGE ORANGE ORANGE! - SOLD!
description:
Can you tell that we love this 1971 Bulova Snorkel with the orange dial? 

Why not? 

The stainless steel C-shaped case is a massive 38mm wide, excluding the unsigned crown...by 40mm from lug to lug. 

Check out the orange dial and those cool shovel-shaped second hand. 

Day, date, everything, working great. 

The bezel turns easily in either direction, and has some mild wear, as photos show. Nothing to detract from the immense appeal of this beast. 

Comes on a aftermarket stainless steel jubilee-style band that fits a 7.5 inch wrist snugly.  

Amazing watch.

name: VINTAGE OMEGA SPEEDMASTER RED BLACK BLUE - AMAZING - SOLD!
description:
You know we love Speedmasters, and none more than this recent model, with red-black-blue subdials and chapter ring. 

Cool beyond words. 

This is the 3210.5200, a masterpiece of Omega precision and style. 
 
Classic dimensions: 40mm wide, excluding the signed Omega crown, by 46mm from lug to massive lug. 

The solid stainless steel case is excellent. As is the domed sapphire crystal. And the bezel, with its tachymetric scale. 

The caliber 1164 automatic movement keeps excellent time. All chrono functions work perfectly. 

The solid stainless steel Omega bracelet will fit a 7.5 inch wrist easily, with room to spare. 

Comes with all boxes, including the inner red Omega box, the white outer box, instruction manual, warranty cards and original hang tag. 

Enough said.

name: VINTAGE LECOULTRE CHRONO 18K SOLID GOLD VALJOUX 72 - SOLD!
description:
Mega-rare and absolutely amazing: A vintage Lecoultre chronograph in solid 18k gold (excluding the pushers and crown). 

The case is 35mm wide, excluding the unsigned crown, by 41mm from lug to lug. In amazingly good condition; one tiny dimple on the back of the case and one on the side are the only blemishes I see. 

A tiny bit of the gold plating on the pushers is also worn away, nothing major.  

Check out the Valjoux 72, the same movement used in some models of Rolex Daytona. 

So cool. 

The dial has a bit of patina to it, particularly on the subdials, as it should. 

The chronograph functions are working perfectly. 

Rare. Gorgeous. What are you waiting for?  More questions, please email.

name: VINTAGE ROLEX CELLINI 18K SOLID GOLD MANUAL w/ ROLEX CROCODILE BAND - SOLD!
description:
Here's a 1970s Rolex classic, a solid 18k gold Cellini in excellent condition, with a Rolex crocodile band with Rolex clasp. 

Check out the mint golden dial, a classic of understatement and elegance. 

This is the Rolex model 4114, in a magnificent rectangular case, 30mm wide excluding the signed Rolex crown, by 37mm from lug to lug. 

The 19 jewel, Rolex 1601 manual movement is keeping excellent time. 

And let's not forget the rare Rolex brown crocodile band with the Rolex clasp. It is well worn but still useable.

name: VINTAGE OMEGA SEAMASTER w/BOX AND PAPERS- Sold!
description:
You don't see this everyday: a 1956 Omega Seamaster in solid stainless steel with box and papers! 

What a great collector's find! 

Check out the two-toned dial with the gold markers and slashing hands...any wonder this is one of the best selling watches in the world of all time? 

The solid stainless case is in excellent condition, with just some minor scratches.  Classic dimensions: 34 mm across, excluding the unsigned crown...by 42mm from lug to beefy lug. 

The dial does have a blemish mark aroudn the 10, and some light patina elsewhere.  Nothing to distract from the power of this classic. 

The Caliber 501 automatic movement is keeping excellent time, just as you'd expect. 

Comes with the original green Omega signed box and papers.  Amazing.

name: MEGA-MEGA RARE HAMILTON CHRONOMATIC COUNTDOWN GMT STEEL - SOLD!
description:
Here's a legend that is rarely sighted in vintage watch circles...and even more rarely found in this excellent condition. 

Red, black, magnificent: We here at VWC are proud to introduce the Hamilton Countdown GMT Chronomatic, a 1960s beast. 

Yes, we just sold one of these to a buyer in Italy...but we were lucky enough to pounce on another. In just as excellent condition.

It's huge, 48mm wide, excluding the crown...or should we say, crowns? 

Five of them, controlling everything from the setting of time (natch) to rotate 24-hour and time-zone bezels internally. 

52mm from lug to lug...this is no Planet Ocean wannabe. This is the progenitor of the modern megawatch. 

The brushed satin solid stainless steel case is in excellent condition, with just a few blemishes here and there, and one larger scratch that we have highlighted in a photo. The red and blue color-coded crowns also show a bit of chipping, but nothing major and certainly nothing that diminshes the immense appeal of this watch. 

The 17-jewel automatic movement is keeping excellent time. 

Hamilton collectors, this watch doesn't come around often. We know...we've searched for years! 

Strap it on. You will know nirvana.

name: VINTAGE OMEGA SPEEDMASTER MARK II RALLY  - SOLD!
description:
Here's a classic Omega Speedmaster Mark II with the amazing rally dial in black, yellow, and cherry red. 

So cool. 

This is a heavy but wearable 42mm across, excluding the signed Omega crown...by 46mm from lug to lug. It is Model 145.014.

The solid stainless steel case is excellent, with light scratches throughout.

The crystal is clear. 

This beast is powered by a 17-jewel Caliber 861 manual movement. It keeps excellent time. 

On a new buffalo-style leather strap with white stitching. 

You don't often see these Speedmasters in such excellent condition. Strap it on and start a conversation.

name: VINTAGE OMEGA SPEEDMASTER MARK III CHRONO AUTO STEEL - SOLD!
description:
Here's a cool 1970s Omega Speedmaster chrono. This Mark III automatic is a beast, big and heavy.  Not for the faint of wrist! 

The massive stainless steel case in this model 176.002 is 53mm from lug to lug and 42mm across, not counting the signed Omega crown. 

The cobalt blue dial is in excellent condition. Gotta love that yellow GMT hand in the shape of an airplane.  

The automatic Caliber 1040 is keeping excellent time. 

The case has some dings and scratches, nothing major. I've included one photo of a ding on the bottom of the case.  

The watch has a new crystal. 

The original steel Omega bracelet fits a 7.5 inch wrist comfortably.

Don't see these around in this condition very often!  Strap it on...Everyone will notice!

name: LONGINES 18K WHITE GOLD MANUAL w/DIAMOND BEZEL - SOLD!
description:
Here's a classic Longines that you don't see often:  18k solid white gold. Diamond bezel. 

So cool. 

The pearl-white dial is mint, with long, slender hands and an elegant subseconds dial. 

Classic dimensions: 32mm excluding the signed Longines crown...by 36mm from lug to lug. 

The manual wind movement sets silkily and keeps excellent time. Photos available on request. 

Diamonds? 18k white gold? What else could you want?

name: VINTAGE UNIVERSAL GENEVE MILITARY WATCH - SOLD!
description:
Here's a World War II era Universal Geneve manual wind military watch that has seen some action. 

Check out the cool patina on the dial, and that red seconds hand. Awesome.

The case is a classic 31mm wide, excluding the unsigned crown by 40mm from lug to lug. It is made of an early stainless steel called Enversteel, heavy with chromium. There's some pitting and discoloration along both sides and elsewhere, as photos show, but to my mind, this only adds to the gritty authenticity of the watch. 

The Caliber 267 manual movement winds easily and keeps excellent time.

name: VINTAGE LECOULTRE MEMOVOX HPG - SOLD!
description:
Followers of this page know how we feel about LeCoultres. here is one of our all-time favorites: a 1970s LeCoultre Memovox HPG.

Amazing blue dial in mint condition. 

Amazing oval-shaped stainless steel case, 37mm wide by 43mm from lug to massive lug...in excellent condition. 

Amazing original steel link band with LeCoultre clasp, easily fits a 7.4 inch wrist. 

Have I mentioned this watch is amazing? 

The automatic 17-jewel movement is keeping excellent time. 

Can you resist this one? You cannot.  

The photos say it all. More photos on request.

name: VINTAGE BREITLING CHRONO MANUAL - SOLD!
description:
Here's a vintage 1970s-80s Breitling chrono in black and silver. 

So cool. 


Check out the silver and charcoal gray dial in minty condition...the massive stainless steel case, a massive 38mm across by 44mm from lug to lug. 

The 17-jewel Lemania 1873 manual movement winds and sets smoothy, keeps excellent time. 

The aftermarket stainless steel band fits a 7.5 inch wrist. 

You don't see these vintage chronos in such great condition often. Strap it on.  Attract some attention.

name: VINTAGE WAKMANN CHRONO - SOLD!
description:
Here's a cool Wakmann chrono with a great color combination: light chocolate subdials, yellow and gray hands, and a yellow seconds hand. 

The solid stainless cushion case is in excellent condition. It's a wearable 38mm wide, excluding the unsigned crown, by 40mm from lug to lug. A few scratches and a tiny blemish on the case back, nothing to detract from the powerful appeal of this watch.

The 17-jewel manual movement is very similar to the one that powers Omega Flightmasters...keeping excellent time.  

These Wakmann chronos are hot. Find out why.

name: VINTAGE BREITLING SUPEROCEAN HERITAGE AUTO w/BRACELET, BOX, PAPERS
description:
Here's a circa 2007 classic: a bronze-dialed Breitling Superocean Heritage automatic chronometer with the original Breitling steel link band.

So cool.   

Check out the bronzed dial with matching bezel, all in mint condition. The huge arrow-shaped hour hand, the massive steel markers...who wouldn't love it? 

This Breitling is not for the faint-of-wrist. This solid stainless steel beast is a huge 46mm wide, excluding the signed, screw-down crown...by a massive 54mm from lug to lug. 

The chronometric movement in this Model A17320 keeps excellent time, as you'd expect. The quick change date functions flawlessly. The sapphire crystal is unblemished. 

The heavy mesh band is a Breitling masterpiece. It fits a 7.5 inch wrist snugly and there is an extra link included. 

Comes with inner and outer boxes, and instructional manual, but not the warranty certificate.  It is guaranteed authentic. And guaranteed to turn heads. Retail on this was $3945. 

Strap it on.

name: VINTAGE ZODIAC SEAWOLF 10K GOLD BEZEL with ZODIAC BAND AND BOX - HOLD!!!
description:
Another grail! A 1960s Zodiac Sea Wolf with the 10k bezel and matching Zodiac-signed gold and stainless link band. 

Check out the black dial with gold-lined markers and those famous slashing Sea Wolf hands. So cool. 

Legendary dimensions: 35mm wide, excluding the unsigned crown...by 42mm from lug to lug, all in excellent condition. 

The stainless steel and gold-link band fits a 7.5 inch wrist easily. 

The automatic movement keeps excellent time. 

This is the non quickset date model without hacking movement. 

Comes with red Zodiac box. 

The Sea Wolf is a legend, tested in the jungles of Viet Nam, a huge favorite of collectors for decades.

name: VINTAGE OMEGA CONSTELLATION CROSSHAIRS DIAL w/ORIGINAL GF BEADS OF RICE BRACELET - SOLD!
description:
A circa 1967 Omega Constellation with crosshair dial and the original beads of rice gold-filled bracelet. This dial is unrestored, untouched, and unbelievable. There's a bit of patina, as you can see, exactly as you'd expect in a watch of this vintage. 

Gold-capped case in classic dimensions...34mm wide, excluding the signed crown, by 42mm from lug to beefy lug. 

The gold conservatory medallion on the back has all eight stars shining brightly! 

The Caliber 564 automatic movement is working perfectly. 

The bracelet fits a 7.5 inch wrist and is in excellent condition, with some stretch, as you'd expect.  

You don't see these vintage Omegas in this condition often...strap it on...People will notice!

name: VINTAGE WAKMANN TRIPLE CALENDAR VALJOUX 730 - SOLD!
description:
Here's a vintage 1970s Wakmann Triple Calendar with the famed Valjoux 730 movement. Everything works perfectly. 

The dial is near mint...a cool satin finish with black-and-gold hands and subdials. 

So very cool. 

This is a workhorse of a watch, not a museum piece. The gold-filled bezel with stainless steel back has its share of dings and a bit of plating loss along one edge (see photo.) The pushers and unsigned crown have also lost some gold plating.  The crystal has a tiny crack at the edge of the 9 but you have to look closely to see it. No big deal.  

If you're looking for a pristine queen, this isn't it. If you're looking for a great-running watch that shows it has withstood the test of time, come ahead! 

The watch measures a hefty 38mm wide, excluding crown, by 42mm from lug to beefy lug. It looks great on the wrist. 

The Valjoux 730, as we said, is working well. 

All in all, these Wakmann triple calendars are rare and sought after. Find out why.

name: VINTAGE ZODIAC SUPER SEA WOLF w/FULL KIT and EXTRA BAND- SOLD!
description:
Followers of this site know that we love Zodiacs. 

None more than this one: a late 1990s Zodiac Super Sea Wolf in MINT condition with the full kit AND an extra stainless steel bracelet. 

Check out that cool updated black dial with the orange markers and hour hand.  The massive diver's bezel. The sand-blasted steel case, a massive 42mm wide, excluding the signed, screw-down crown. 

This watch was barely worn: The plastic cover is still on the back! 

The heavy-link solid stainless band fits a 7.5 inch wrist comfortably. 

AND there's another Zodiac band with this, a lighter brushed steel link bracelet that runs just over 6 inches. 

Comes with a leather zippered pouch with dive charts, rubber strap and strap extension, manual, a strap changing tool and the extra Zodiac bracelet. 

The 25-jewel ETA automatic movement is keeping excellent time; the quick date function works perfectly. 

Only 350 of these were ever made. 

You. Need. One.

name: VINTAGE BULOVA ACCUTRON BLUE BLACK UP DOWN - SOLD!
description:
Another legend from Accutron. A blue/black up/down. The killer combination here: Blue. Black. Steel. 

The swooping blue Accutron tuning fork seconds hand against a jet black dial...the blue roman numerals and markers...the day in a window at the 12, the date in blue at the 6.  

How can you not love this 1969 218? 

Blue markers and date, swooping blue tuning fork seconds hand...That cool oval stainless case, in excellent condition... 38mm wide, not counting the signed Accutron crown...by 41mm from lug to lug. 

The tuning fork movement is keeping excellent time. 

In the 1960s and 70s, there was one watch every American man craved. Accutron. Want to know why? Take a look. Strap it on. You won't want to take it off.

name: VINTAGE ENICAR SEAPEARL 600 -On HOLD!
description:
Enicar fans -- and who isn't? -- know this classic cold: It's an circa 1950s Enicar Seapearl 600.

Check out those cool diver's style markers...with great patina. The monster hour and minute hands. And that cool lighting bolt seconds hand. 

This Seapearl dial has some heavy patina and has taken on a dark khaki color. So cool. There's also a bit of lume missing from the minute hand, but hey, to our eyes, this just makes it all the more authentic. 

The stainless steel case is 34mm wide, excluding the signed Enicar crown, and a massive 43mm from lug to ribbon lug. The back of case has a couple of deeper scratches, as photos show, but nothing to detract from the immense appeal of this watch.

The manual 17 jewel movement is keeping excellent time. Want a vintage watch that not everyone else has? Here it is. Strap it on. People will notice.

name: VINTAGE WOMEN'S BEDAT DIAMOND DIAL STEEL QUARTZ - SOLD!
description:
Here's a women's Bedat with a diamond dial and a solid stainless steel link band. 

Check out the amazing textured black dial with a sunburst in the center...and those cool ornate hands.  

Classic smaller women's dimensions: 25mm wide, excluding the signed crown...by 28mm from lug to lug. 

No box or papers, but the sticker is still on the back of this watch. 

The band is full sized. 

This is reference 300, with a quartz movement and a fresh battery. Keeps excellent time. But you already knew that.

name: VINTAGE ETERNAMATIC AUTO STEEL -SOLD!
description:
Here's a classic 1960s Eternamatic automatic with a minty eggshell-white Calatrava-style dial and gold markers. 

Classic dimensions: 34mm across, excluding the signed crown..by 42mm from lug to beefy lug. 

These Eternas are the epitome of workhorse watches, minimalist design...and just plain cool. 

The 17-jewel automatic movement keeps excellent time. 

Comes on a new Hirsch brown croc-style leather band.

name: VINTAGE NIVADA GRENCHEN CHRONOMASTER AVIATOR SEA DIVER - SOLD!
description:
Here's the iconic Nivada Grenchen Chronomaster Aviator Sea Diver, one of the most sought-after divers in the world. 

Check out that jet black dial with the broad-arrow hour hand, the red subdial and red seconds hand...gotta have it? We know the feeling. 

Classic 1970s diver dimensons: 38mm wide by 44mm from lug to burly lug. 

This is a wearable diver but also one of those watches with incredible wrist presence. 

The diver's bezel is in excellent shape. The dial itself is so detailed and clean that you'd be hard pressed not to believe that it has spent its time in a safe somewhere. 

The Valjoux 23 movement is keeping excellent time. 

If you ever wanted one of these -- and who hasn't? -- here's the one to get.

name: VINTAGE BAUME & MERCIER 14K SOLID GOLD QUARTZ -SOLD
description:
We love roman numeral dials, and this one is a killer. A Baume & Mercier solid 14k gold masterpiece. 

Check out that intricate, textured dial, gold on black. Who ever did it better? 

Thin and elegant, at 31mm wide excluding the signed Baume & Mercier crown...by 37mm from lug to lug. 

The quartz movement has a fresh battery, keeps excellent time. 

So cool.

name: VINTAGE BULOVA ACCUTRON SPACEVIEW 14K SOLID GOLD "FOOTBALL CASE"
description:
In the 1960s and 70s, every American man wanted an Accutron...and the one they craved was the 14k solid gold Spaceview.  

Check out this ultra rare 1961 Spaceview in 14k solid gold with the highly sought asymmetric "football" case. 


Cool. 

Accutron developed the space age tuning fork movement and then came up with another brilliant innovation: Show the inside of this technical marvel. What was supposed to be an advertising gimmick ignited a craze in 1960 that has never died.  

This Spaceview is a beefy 33mm wide, by 41mm from lug to floating lug. Just a few normal scratches, nothing major.   

The watch is freshly serviced, and keeping excellent time. 

You don't see these early Spaceviews often on Ebay, and not in this excellent condition and not in heavy 14k. It turns heads. Believe us.

name: VINTAGE LORD ELGIN EXTREME DECO  - SOLD!
description:
Here's a classic Lord Elgin manual in Deco style, with a cool asymmetric 10k gold-filled case and Kreisler gold-filled band. 

Check out those slashing sword hands and minimalist markers, all under a new, massively cool domed crystal. 

The 10k gold-filled asymmetric case is the star of this show ... 22mm wide excluding the unsigned crown by 35mm from lug to lug. 

It is in very good condition, with just a few minor dings and scratches...There is also some plating loss on the opening tab on the back of the case, as photo shows. But nothing to detract from the immense appeal of this classic. 

The 21-jewel movement keeps excellent time. 

Comes with a Kreisler stainless band, with a textured, tree-bark insert and gold-filled tops for stretch links. 

All in all, magnificent.

name: VINTAGE WOMEN'S CARTIER PANTHERE 18k GOLD/STEEL CLASSIC - SOLD!
description:
A women's classic Cartier Panthere, in 18k gold and steel. 

Check out the Cartier roman numeral dial with a bit of patina around the 11 and along the edges elsewhere.  

Classic women's smaller dimensions: 22mm across, excluding the blue sapphire Cartier crown, by 30mm from lug to lug. 

The quartz movement is keeping excellent time. 

The link band, 18k gold and stainless, is full length and in good condition with some stretch. 

All in all, a masterpiece from Cartier. 

Enough said.

name: VINTAGE HAMILTON ODYSSEE - A MOVIE STAR!
description:
Here's a Hamilton space age icon: The 1968 Odyssee 2001, introduced as part of the run-up to Stanley Kubrick's landmark movie, "2001, A Space Odyssey." 

Check out the asymmetric "flying saucer" case, in solid stainless steel...the two-tone black-and-silver dial with just a bit of patina...the date porthole at the 6... 

An amazing must-have for watch collectors. 

The watch is a wearable 37mm, excluding the unsigned, recessed crown...There are some light scratches and dings throughout ( few larger ones on the caseback), as befits a watch of this age, but nothing...nothing... to detract from the immense appeal of this classic.  

The automatic movement keeps excellent time; photos of movement available on request. 

The watch comes with an aftermarket Airflex mesh band that will fit a 7.5 inch wrist with just a little room left over. 

Here's a vintage watch that rivets the eye.  In the 1950s and 1960s Hamilton astonished the watch world, and everyone else, with futuristic designs

Want a vintage that will turn heads? WHo doesn't? Here it is.

name: VINTAGE BULOVA CALENDAR AUTO - SOLD!
description:
One of the coolest Bulovas ever: a 1957 triple calendar watch. 

Just check out the two-tone dial...red month pointer, red-lined day window...slashing gold hands. 

The 10k gold-filled case with bottlecap bezel and horned lugs is in excellent condition...

One note: there is some corrision damage to the tab on the back of the case. Please see photos. A lot of these watches have this same damage...There is also a bit of plate separation on the backsides of two of the lugs, at the edges. 

None of this detracts from the immense appeal of this watch. 

Classic dimensions: 34mm wide, excluding the signed Bulova crown...by 43mm from lug to amazing lug. 

The 23-jewel automatic movement keeps excellent time.

name: VINTAGE HAMILTON SPECTRA
description:
n the 1950s and 60s Hamilton pioneered the electric watch and made it into an American classic.

Check out this 14k solid gold Hamilton Spectra. The asymmetric case in 14K solid gold is in excellent condition. It's 35mm wide, excluding the crown and a massive 39mm from lug to lug.

The 500 electric movement is freshly overhauled and working well, keeping excellent time.

These Hamiltons defined a generation of American watchmaking ingenuity. Who can argue?

name: VINTAGE AQUADIVE DIVER AUTO STEEL
description:
Here's a 1970s Aquadive in minty condition, ready to wear. 

Check out the crosshairs dial in shades of red and gray. So cool. 

The cushion case has a solid stainless back and plated bezel, 36mm across by 42mm from lug to lug. It is in very good condition. There are two initials carved on the back lugs, as photos show. 

The xx-jewel movement is keeping excellent time.

name: VINTAGE LEJOUR CHRONO MANUAL - SOLD!
description:
Here's a 1970s LeJour chrono in a great beveled square case with a racing dial. 

Gotta love the orange seconds hand and the cool white subdials. 

This is a heavy 39mm square chrome plated case with solid stainless steel back. There is some plating wear-through on the sides and the crown, as shown in photos (more are available on request), but nothing to detract from the immense appeal of the watch. 

The Valjoux 7734 manual movement has been freshly overhauled and is working well.  The chrono functions work as they should. 

The steel-link solid stainless band fits a 7.75 inch wrist.

Here's a great, affordable chrono that goes with everything from jeans to tux. 

Try it on. You won't want to take it off.

name: VINTAGE GRUEN PRECISION 14K SOLID WHITE GOLD DIAMOND DIAL - SOLD!
description:
Here's one of those great all-time classics: a 1950s Gruen in sold 14k white gold. 

Check out the minty jet black diamond dial with those cool slashing silver markers and the perfect sunburst subdial. And...don't forget the scrolled lugs. 

Amazing. 

Classic smaller dimensions for the 14k solid white gold case, which is in very good condition: 22mm wide, excluding the signed Gruen crown...by 34mm from lug to lug. 

The 21-jewel movement is freshly serviced and keeping excellent time.

Accutron developed the space age tuning fork movement and then came up with another brilliant innovation: Show the inside of this technical marvel. What was supposed to be an advertising gimmick ignited a craze in 1960 that has never died.  

This Spaceview is a beefy 33mm wide, by 41mm from lug to lug. A few light scratches; overall in minty condition.

name: VINTAGE OLLECH & WAJS CHRONO - NEW OLD STOCK PRISTINE - SOLD!
description:
Here's a mega-rare vintage 1970s stolid stainless steel chrono in new old stock condition from the boutique Swiss watchmater Ollech and Wajs, usually known as O & W. 

Check out the TV-style case here, a classic 1970s shape....The absolutely magnificent dial, in a creamy white, with blue and gold accents and a burgundy tachymeter chapter ring.

The massive but manageable dimensions of the day: 42mm wide, excluding the unsigned crowns, by 38mm from lug to lug.  Comes on a new Morellato leather strap. 

The watch is unused; the plastic still stuck to the back of the solid stainless steel case. 


For those unfamiliar with this boutique collector's brand, here's a history written by a collector we know:  "Ollech and Wajs, usually known among collectors as O & W, may be the only Swiss manufacturer since WWII that started as a small company, stayed small during its entire career, but gained iconic status. So many Swiss companies have come and gone since the end of WWII, it's hard to remember the names of even the really top ones, and so many of the small ones are so obscure that watch bulletin boards and collector sites are filled every day with inquiries whether anyone has heard of this brand or that brand.

Within this context, O & W, which still is active to this day, stands out as being particularly remarkable. Although they have never really grown in size beyond the two owners, they have over the years, due to their shrewd choice of niche markets, their innovative marketing and their consistent choice of excellent movements and stable quality at highly competitive prices, gained a following that many larger brands would envy."

Envy is right. Strap this one on. You'll see heads swivel your way.
